entries.title: Peru bans Bolivian politician Evo Morales amid rising tensions
entries.description: Morales criticised the removal of former President Pedro Castillo, who tried to dissolve Peru's Congress last month.

entries.title: NFL player Damar Hamlin continues recovery in Buffalo hospital
entries.description: Doctors say Hamlin, who suffered a cardiac arrest and collapsed during a US football game last week, is 'doing well'.

entries.title: US SEC charges McDonald’s ex-CEO for misrepresentations
entries.description: The SEC hit former CEO Stephen Easterbrook with a five-year officer and director bar and a $400,000 civil penalty.

entries.title: Venezuelan court issues warrants for new opposition leaders
entries.description: The government of Nicolas Maduro has been criticised for barring potential challengers from seeking office.

entries.title: Will Turkey approve Sweden’s NATO membership?
entries.description: Stockholm says Ankara is asking too much and it can't fulfil all its demands.

entries.title: Ukraine enhances defences in east amid relentless Russian attacks
entries.description: Kyiv says it is strengthening forces in Soledar near Bakhmut as it battles attacks by Russia's Wagner mercenary group.

entries.title: Brazil’s former President Jair Bolsonaro admitted to US hospital
entries.description: Bolsonaro's hospitalisation in Florida follows an attack by his supporters against key government offices in Brazil.

entries.title: Nurses in New York City strike over wages and staffing levels
entries.description: More than 7,000 nurses strike at two NYC hospitals, stating that low wages and staffing levels have squeezed workers.

entries.title: WhatsApp’s Pegasus spyware lawsuit can go ahead: US top court
entries.description: Israeli firm NSO Group's spyware has been linked to state surveillance of human rights activists and dissidents.

entries.title: Wales captain Gareth Bale announces retirement from football
entries.description: Forward calls time on decorated career at age 33, says football has given him some of life's 'best moments'.

entries.title: UN Security Council extends critical aid to northern Syria
entries.description: Highest UN decision-making body votes unanimously to keep aid flowing from Turkey to Syria's rebel-held Idlib region.

entries.title: Canada finalises deal to buy dozens of F-35 fighter jets from US
entries.description: Multibillion-dollar agreement marks largest investment in Canadian air force in decades, defence minister says.

entries.title: UN report: Ozone layer slowly healing, set to mend within decades
entries.description: New study says giant hole in the ozone layer that develops every year over Antarctica on course to be healed by 2066.

entries.title: US safety org reviewing Musk tweet on disabling driver monitoring
entries.description: Since 2021, Tesla has been beta-testing 'Full Self-Driving' using owners who haven’t been trained on the system.

entries.title: Sweden aims to reactivate civil conscription to shore up defences
entries.description: Gov't says scheme to focus on boosting capabilities of municipal emergency services to respond in a state of emergency.

entries.title: Brazil leaders condemn ‘terrorist acts’, vow to defend democracy
entries.description: More than 1,500 people detained in relation to attack on government buildings in the Brazilian capital, officials say.

entries.title: In Pictures: Biden declares emergency for storm-hit California
entries.description: California is expecting even more turbulent weather after thunderstorms, snow and damaging winds cross the state.

entries.title: Joe Biden visits Mexico ahead of ‘Three Amigos’ summit
entries.description: Migration, drug trafficking, manufacturing and trade are set to top the agenda of US-Canada-Mexico meetings.

entries.title: Refugee aid workers to go on trial in Greece
entries.description: Lesbos trial involving 24 aid workers could have a chilling effect on humanitarian efforts in Europe, critics say.

entries.title: Thailand makes U-turn on COVID vaccination rule for visitors
entries.description: Minister says checking vaccinations was inconvenient and a panel of health experts had agreed to withdraw the new rule.

entries.title: Roberto Martinez appointed new Portugal coach
entries.description: Martinez replaces Fernando Santos, who left his job after Portugal suffered a shock defeat to Morocco in the World Cup.

entries.title: England counts down to western Europe’s first satellite launch
entries.description: Virgin Orbit to send satellites up from UK on a modified Boeing 747 with a rocket attached under its wing.

entries.title: Pope says Ukraine war ‘a crime against humanity’ in annual speech
entries.description: Head of the Catholic Church slams Russia's war in Ukraine and Iran's treatment of protesters.

entries.title: Armed group abducts 32 people from southern Nigeria train station
entries.description: The incident comes a month after a train service in the north, which was shut after a March 2022 attack, resumed.

entries.title: In ‘market of hate’, a Congress leader’s march to ‘unite India’
entries.description: Experts say Rahul Gandhi's march is an effort to revive fortunes of a party that dominated Indian politics for decades.

entries.title: Bosnian Serbs award Putin with medal of honour
entries.description: Separatist leader awards Russian president with medal for 'patriotic concern' for Bosnia's Republika Srpska entity.

entries.title: Flood-hit Pakistan hosts climate resilience meet with UN for aid
entries.description: UN calls for massive support to help Pakistan with a $16bn rebuilding effort following last year's devastating floods.

entries.title: New Chinese foreign minister heads to Africa for first trip
entries.description: The new foreign minister's visit follows in the footsteps of his predecessors over the last three decades.

entries.title: Why is ‘Republika Srpska Day’ controversial in Bosnia?
entries.description: In Bosnia, Serbs are marking the 31st anniversary of the Republika Srpska entity's founding, despite a court ban.

entries.title: The Three Amigos and the US war on asylum seekers in Mexico
entries.description: Mexican leaders have promised more humane migration policies only to wage a brutal war on migrants on behalf of the US.

entries.title: Iraq’s moment in the football sun
entries.description: After years of devastation, it feels good to see Iraq celebrated internationally — as the host of the Arabian Gulf Cup.

entries.title: Iranians protest in front of Karaj prison as more executions loom
entries.description: Protesters gathered in front of a prison in Karaj to stop the execution of two men linked to Iran's demonstrations.

entries.title: Players could play at Australian Open with COVID, director says
entries.description: Craig Tiley says players will not have to take tests but should stay home if they feel unwell.

entries.title: Cargo vessel refloated after running aground in Suez Canal
entries.description: Suez Canal Authority head says traffic was unaffected by the grounding of the MV Glory vessel.

entries.title: Sinking land, cracking homes force many to flee India’s Joshimath
entries.description: Hundreds moved to shelters after buildings in the Himalayan town popular with pilgrims and tourists develop cracks.

entries.title: Israel orders police to remove Palestine flags from public spaces
entries.description: Far-right security minister Itamar Ben-Gvir said waving the Palestinian flag is an act in support of 'terrorism'.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 320
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 320th day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: Pro-Bolsonaro rioters storm Brazil’s top government offices
entries.description: The unrest in Brazil's capital caps months of tension following Lula's October 30 presidential victory over Bolsonaro.

entries.title: Arrests after Bolsonaro supporters attack key offices in Brazil
entries.description: At least 300 arrested over the riots by Bolsonaro's supporters as questions mount about security lapses in Brasilia.

entries.title: China says it carried out more military drills around Taiwan
entries.description: The latest Chinese drills around Taiwan are the second major military exercises in less than a month.

entries.title: ‘Lula is not alone’: World reacts to Brazil invasion
entries.description: Supporters of Brazil's far-right ex-President Jair Bolsonaro broke through police barricades and stormed govt buildings.

entries.title: Biden makes first visit to US-Mexico border since taking office
entries.description: The trip followed unveiling of new immigration policy that rights groups warn could put asylum seekers' lives at risk.
